customer_reviews.title: A little gem of a camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera it's smaller and lighter than my trusted Canon S.L.R and the photos are just as good. What sold this camera to me was the price and having a viewfinder this is a must on bright sunny days. There are two minor issues the battery won't last as long as a S.L.R camera and the SD memory card is difficult to remove. I recommend a small pair of tweezers for this job. Lastly I'll be taking this Sony camera out with me a lot more than my bulky but very good S.L.R camera.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera all around
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely fantastic camera, especially if you're starting out or looking for a good budget camera. The noise reduction at high ISO is really well done and I can get good shots at 3200 ISO with very little noise. It is capable of shooting at 11 frames per second and has a buffer of 20 images RAW (which I would recommend you to shoot in), so you don't need to get the absolute best SD card (I personally use a SanDisk Extreme Pro). The camera is excellent for macro photography, wildlife photography and astrophotography (what I use it for). The Sony a6000 is overall, a very nice camera. Highly recommended product.

customer_reviews.title: Budget video shooter's ideal purchase

Battery life is poor but not completely hopeless, and the lack of S log is a shame but understandable given it's release date. In short, slap a fast 50mm lens on the front, keep the picture profile flat and stick to the crop sensor's dynamic range limitations, and you have yourself a VERY cinematic image indeed.

customer_reviews.title: Small Camera Big Performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after seeing several professionals giving rave reviews about its capabilities and I'm seriously impressed. Light to carry and offering great features at an affordable price. 24 megapixel, low noise and 11 frames per second. I sold my Nikon DSLR, but kept a Nikon 105 macro lens, which works perfectly (in manual mode) with this camera via a lens adapter. I have recently used it for cityscape photography, where the small unobtrusive design and light weight are ideal for hand held street photography. Highly recommended.

That said, it's moderately well made, although it's not Japanese quality – and the pictures are very good when in RAW+JPG mode. Battery doesn't last long, best to take a second unit.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed over lack of control and failed images.
customer_reviews.text: I am used to using a DSLR using spot focusing and metering. This camera is not able to do this, and any other form of intelligent focusing fails 3 out of 10 times. It seems far less reliable for a decent picture than my basic point and shoots. I bought it for the size, but will now look at changing to a basic Nikon DSLR for better control, and not much bigger in the hand.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Lens very fragile
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera for about 3 months now and it is brilliant for selfies and portrait. However, it is way too fragile.
